articles.title: No. 17 Maryland women beat Ohio State 72-62
articles.description: COLLEGE PARK, Md. (AP) — Kaila Charles had 28 points, seven rebounds and four steals to help No. 17 Maryland beat Ohio State 72-62 on Monday night.
articles.content:
COLLEGE PARK, Md. (AP) Kaila Charles had 28 points, seven rebounds and four steals to help No. 17 Maryland beat Ohio State 72-62 on Monday night.

articles.author: By BILL BARROW Associated Press
articles.title: Biden's foreign policy prowess tested by Iran tensions
articles.description: Rising tensions between Washington and Tehran are testing whether Joe Biden can capitalize on his decades of foreign policy experience as he seeks to challenge a president he derides as “dangerous” and “erratic.”
articles.content:

articles.title: Patberg scores 19, No. 12 Indiana women beat Illinois 83-42
articles.description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind. (AP) — Ali Patberg scored 19 points, Mackenzie Holmes had 16 points and eight rebounds, and No. 12 Indiana beat Illinois 83-42 on Monday night for its ninth straight victory in the series.
articles.content:
BLOOMINGTON, Ind. (AP) Ali Patberg scored 19 points, Mackenzie Holmes had 16 points and eight rebounds, and No. 12 Indiana beat Illinois 83-42 on Monday night for its ninth straight victory in the series.

articles.title: Ish Smith's 27 points help Wizards top no-Kemba Celts 99-94
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Missing Kemba Walker, the Boston Celtics became the latest NBA contender to surprisingly come up short against one of the league's worst teams, losing 99-94 to the Washington Wizards, who got 27 points from Ish Smith to…

articles.title: Coastal Carolina beats Louisiana-Monroe 93-64
articles.description: CONWAY, S.C. (AP) — Devante Jones and Keishawn Brewton scored 17 points apiece and Coastal Carolina never trailed in beating UL Monroe 93-64 on Monday night for coach Cliff Ellis' 240th career win.
articles.content:
CONWAY, S.C. (AP) Devante Jones and Keishawn Brewton scored 17 points apiece and Coastal Carolina never trailed in beating UL Monroe 93-64 on Monday night for coach Cliff Ellis' 240th career win.

articles.title: SpaceX launches 60 more satellites, trying to tone them down
articles.description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla. (AP) — SpaceX launched 60 more mini internet satellites late Monday, this time testing a dark coating to appease stargazers.
articles.content:
CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla. (AP) SpaceX launched 60 more mini internet satellites late Monday, this time testing a dark coating to appease stargazers.

articles.author: By STEVE REED AP Sports Writer
articles.title: Warren scores 36 to lead Pacers past Hornets 115-104
articles.description: CHARLOTTE, N.C. (AP) — T.J. Warren scored 30 of his season-high 36 points in the second half, and the Indiana Pacers beat the Charlotte Hornets 115-104 on Monday night to snap a two-game skid.
articles.content:
CHARLOTTE, N.C. (AP) T.J. Warren scored 30 of his season-high 36 points in the second half, and the Indiana Pacers beat the Charlotte Hornets 115-104 on Monday night to snap a two-game skid.

articles.title: Nissan says ex-leader Ghosn still behind serious misconduct
articles.description: TOKYO (AP) — Nissan said Tuesday its former chairman, Carlos Ghosn, is still behind what it sees as “serious misconduct” found in an investigation at the Japanese automaker.
articles.content:

articles.title: Police: 1 dead, 1 wounded in shooting at a Louisiana Walmart
articles.description: NEW ORLEANS (AP) — One person was fatally shot at a Walmart on Monday evening and another was wounded, Louisiana authorities said. Police said they arrested a man suspected in the shooting.
articles.content:

articles.description: WEST POINT, N.Y. (AP) — Nelly Cummings hit six straight free throws in the final 23 seconds to allow Colgate to hold off a furious Army rally to earn a 70-65 Patriot League victory on Monday night.

articles.title: California gorilla treated for cataract
articles.description: SAN DIEGO (AP) — A team of eye experts has operated on an unusual patient — a gorilla.
articles.content:
SAN DIEGO (AP) A team of eye experts has operated on an unusual patient a gorilla.
A cataract was removed on Dec. 10 from the left eye of a 3-year-old western lowland gorilla who lives at the San Diego Zoo Safari Park, the park announced Monday.
